DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study examine D-Cycloserine effective adjunct internet-based cognitive behaviour therapy patient obsessive-compulsive disorder .
DOC.detailed_description: Trial Objectives : Primary aim investigate whether D-Cycloserine give incremental effect ICBT term reduce OCD symptom . Secondary aim ) replicate previous finding DCS fasten effect CBT , b ) correlate fasten effect overall treatment adherence c ) investigate gene variation therapeutic factor predictor symptom severity , symptom type treatment response . Trial Design : Double blind randomize control trial Dose/Duration : 5 capsule 50 mg D-Cycloserine placebo . 1 pc per week 5 week . All participant also receive Internet-based cognitive behavior therapy 12 week . Primary Endpoint : Change W0-W13 3-months follow-up . Efficacy Parameters : Y-BOCS clinician rat . Safety Parameters : Adverse Events assessed weekly via internet also post-treatment 3-months follow-up use face-to-face clinician assessment . Description Trial Subjects : Fulfilling diagnostic criterion OCD associate hoard . Number Subjects : 128
DOC.criteria: Outpatients Male female ≥ 18 year Currently live Stockholm , Uppland , Örebro , Södermanland , Gästrikland , Västmanland Östergötland county Sweden . Primary diagnosis OCD accord DSMIVTR . Signed informed consent Have regular access computer internet access skill use web Have receive information need use contraception Pregnancy breast feeding Patients unlikely cooperate fully study Patients able read understand basic ICBT selfhelp material Psychotropic medication change within two month prior treatment Completed CBT OCD within last 12 month YBOCS [ 21 ] < 16 Psychiatrist visit ( 6.2.3 ) pi OCD symptom primarily associate hoarding . Other primary axis I diagnosis accord MiniInternational Neuropsychiatric Interview ( MINI ) [ 34 ] Ongoing substance dependence Lifetime bipolar disorder psychosis Suicidal ideation Axis II diagnosis could jeopardize treatment participation Serious physical illness obstacle ICBT DCS Other ongoing psychological treatment could affect OCD symptom Epilepsia Renal impairment Hypersensitivity DCycloserine Porphyria Chronic Alcoholism
